qas.question: Along with the Eagle and Child, at what pub did the Inklings regularly meet?
Where is the Eagle and Child located?
Along with J. R. R. Tolkien, who was a noted member of the Inklings?
Where is the Eagle pub located?
On what date did Francis Crick announce to an audience of pub-goers that he had discovered DNA?

context: The Eagle and Child and <a0_0>the Lamb and Flag<a0_0/>, <a1_0>Oxford<a1_0/>, were regular meeting places of the Inklings, a writers' group which included J. R. R. Tolkien and <a2_0>C. S. Lewis<a2_0/>. The Eagle in <a3_0>Cambridge<a3_0/> is where Francis Crick interrupted patrons' lunchtime on <a4_0>28 February 1953<a4_0/> to announce that he and James Watson had "discovered the secret of life" after they had come up with their proposal for the structure of DNA. The anecdote is related in Watson's book The Double Helix. and commemorated with a blue plaque on the outside wall.
